{{use mdy dates|date=February 2014}} {{Infobox video game | title=Dracula 2: The Last Sanctuary | image = Dracula 2 - The Last Sanctuary.jpg | caption = North American PC cover art | developer = [[MC2 France#Wanadoo Edition|Wanadoo]] | publisher = {{ubl|[[MC2 France#Index+|Index+]]|[[Orange S.A.|France Telecom Multimedia]]|[[Canal+ Group|Canal+ Multimedia]]|[[Cryo Interactive]] {{small|(Europe)}}|[[DreamCatcher Interactive]] {{small|(North America)}}|[[Microïds]] {{small|(iOS, OS X, Android)}}}} | designer = Jacques Simian | programmer = {{ubl|Philippe Bouet|François Villard}} | writer = {{ubl|Jacques Simian|François Villard}} | composer = Laurent Parisi | platforms = [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Mac OS]], [[PlayStation (console)|PlayStation]], [[iOS]], [[OS X]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]] | released = {{collapsible list|titlestyle=font-weight:normal;background:transparent;text-align:left;|title=September 25, 2000|'''Windows'''<ref>{{cite web | url=http://us.gamespot.com/dracula-the-last-sanctuary/related/release/platform/pc/ | title=Dracula: Last Sanctuary (PC) Release Summary | publisher=[[GameSpot]] | accessdate=October 19, 2013 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120627063419/http://www.gamespot.com/dracula-the-last-sanctuary/related/release/platform/pc/ | archivedate=June 27, 2012}}</ref>{{vgrelease|EU|September 25, 2000|NA|February 11, 2001}}'''Mac OS'''{{vgrelease|NA|February 11, 2001<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/mac/633269-dracula-the-last-sanctuary/data | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary Release Data | publisher=[[GameFAQs]] | accessdate=January 23, 2016}}</ref>}}'''PlayStation'''{{vgrelease|WW|May 6, 2002<ref>{{cite web | url=http://us.gamespot.com/dracula-the-last-sanctuary/related/release/platform/ps/ | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary (PlayStation) | publisher=[[GameSpot]] | accessdate=October 19, 2013 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120111190328/http://www.gamespot.com/dracula-the-last-sanctuary/platform/ps | archivedate=January 11, 2012}}</ref>}}'''iOS''' & '''OS X'''{{vgrelease|WW|February 25, 2012<ref name="iOS">{{cite web | url=http://www.dracula.microids.com/data/cp/275/pr-dracula-santuary-en.pdf | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary draws blood on Mac, iPhone and iPad | publisher=[[Microïds]] | format=PDF | date=March 9, 2012 | accessdate=September 22, 2013}}</ref>}}'''Android'''{{vgrelease|WW|October 9, 2013<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.facebook.com/microids/posts#!/microids/posts/10151662974392405 | title=Microïds Official | publisher=[[Facebook]] | date=October 9, 2013 | accessdate=October 20, 2013}}</ref>}}}} | genre = [[Adventure game#Point-and-click adventure games|Point-and-click adventure]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }}
'''''Dracula 2: The Last Sanctuary''''' (originally released as '''''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary''''') is a 2000 [[Adventure game#Point-and-click adventure games|point-and-click adventure]] [[video game]] developed by [[MC2 France#Wanadoo Edition|Wanadoo]] and jointly published by [[MC2 France#Index+|Index+]], [[Orange S.A.|France Telecom Multimedia]], [[Canal+ Group|Canal+ Multimedia]] and [[Cryo Interactive]]. Originally released for [[Microsoft Windows]] and [[Mac OS]], it was ported to the [[PlayStation (console)|PlayStation]] in 2002. In 2012, a slightly modified version developed and published by [[Microïds]] was released for [[iOS]] and [[OS X]], and, in 2013, for [[Android (operating system)|Android]]. In 2014, the remade iOS/OS X/Android version was made available on [[Steam (software)|Steam]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dracula.microids.com/data/cp/450/pr-steam-dracula-1-2-3-en.pdf | title=Microïds announces the release of the first three games from the Dracula saga on Steam | publisher=[[Microïds]] | date=April 18, 2014 | format=PDF | accessdate=January 23, 2016}}</ref>
The game is a direct sequel to ''[[Dracula: Resurrection]]'', which itself is an unofficial sequel to [[Bram Stoker]]'s ''[[Dracula]]''; set seven years after the end of the novel, [[Jonathan Harker]] finds that he must once again do battle with the evil [[Count Dracula]] in an effort to save his wife, [[Mina Harker|Mina]]. A third game, with an unrelated storyline, followed in 2008, ''[[Dracula 3: The Path of the Dragon]]''. A loose sequel to ''Path of the Dragon'' was released in a two-part form in 2013; ''[[Dracula 4: The Shadow of the Dragon]]'' and ''[[Dracula 5: The Blood Legacy]]''.
''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'' was most widely reviewed for the PC, where it received mixed reviews, with critics praising the graphics, but criticising the nature of some of the puzzles. By 2007, the game and its predecessor had reached combined global sales above 1 million units.
==Gameplay== ''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'' is a [[First-person (video games)|first-person]] [[Adventure game#Point-and-click_adventure_games|point-and-click adventure game]], which employs an "empty" [[Head-up display|HUD]]; the player's inventory is accessible through a button press, whilst another button press will bring the player to a screen with options to [[Saved game|save]] their game, quit their game, or load a previously saved game. As such, the entire screen depicts only direct [[gameplay]].<ref>{{cite book | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary PC Instruction Manual | url=http://www.replacementdocs.com/download.php?view.5036 | chapter=Main menu screen | publisher=[[DreamCatcher Interactive]] | year=2000 | page=4 | accessdate=February 23, 2016}}</ref>
The game uses a basic point-and-click interface to move the player around and manipulate the game world. Within each static screen, the player is free to look around 360 degrees. As the player moves the [[Cursor (user interface)|cursor]] around the screen it can change into different styles depending on the situation; neutral cursor (no interaction is possible), an arrow (the player can move in the direction indicated), an arrow within a red circle (access temporarily blocked) a hand (the player can take the object), a magnifying glass (an area which can be examined in more detail), a backwards arrow (the player can move backwards from an area with which they have examined via the magnifying glass), a cog (the player must use an inventory item to initiate interaction with the object), a cog with a hand (the player can operate the object without using an inventory item), an object within a red circle (use of the item temporarily prohibited).<ref>{{cite book | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary PC Instruction Manual | url=http://www.replacementdocs.com/download.php?view.5036 | chapter=Controls for exploration and action | publisher=[[DreamCatcher Interactive]] | year=2000 | page=5 | accessdate=February 23, 2016}}</ref>
The most often encountered symbol in the game is the cog. When the player encounters this symbol, they must enter their inventory and select an item. If it is the correct item to operate the object, the item will appear in a green circle, replacing the cog icon. If it is the incorrect item, the cog icon will remain.<ref name="IGN">{{cite web | url=http://ie.ign.com/articles/2001/03/15/dracula-the-last-sanctuary | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary (PC) Review | publisher=[[IGN]] | date=March 14, 2001 | last=Butts | first=Steve | accessdate=September 22, 2013}}</ref>
[[File:Dracula Last Sanctuary gameplay.jpg|thumb|230px|left|Harker faces one of Dracula's creatures in combat mode. Note the time meter along the top of the screen. If the player fails to act fast enough, the creature will stare the player down, prompting a "Game Over" screen.]] The game introduces two new elements not found in ''Dracula: Resurrection''; rudimentary combat and combining inventory items. Combat mode replaces the cursor with a [[reticle]], and occurs infrequently, involving either a [[revolver]] or a [[crossbow]]. It is usually (but not always) timed, and often requires the player to perform a particular action, such as hitting the enemy in a specific spot to achieve victory. If they fail to do so within the designated time, the player will die.<ref name="ACG">{{cite web | url=http://www.adventureclassicgaming.com/index.php/site/reviews/201/ | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary (PC) Review | publisher=[[Adventure Classic Gaming]] | last=Howe | first=Zack | date=June 15, 2006 | accessdate=October 1, 2013}}</ref> In relation to combining inventory items, unlike in the first game, the inventory screen is divided into two - a full circle, and a small semi-circle on the outer edge of the screen. Items placed within the semi-circle cannot be used directly in the game itself, but must be combined by the player with items placed within the full circle. For example, the player's gun is in the full circle, but their bullets are placed within the semi circle.<ref>{{cite book | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary PC Instruction Manual | url=http://www.replacementdocs.com/download.php?view.5036 | chapter=The dynamic inventory | publisher=[[DreamCatcher Interactive]] | year=2000 | page=6 | accessdate=February 23, 2016}}</ref>
The 2012 [[iOS]] version adds several new features to the game, such as an optional help feature (which highlights interactive zones on each screen), a "quick inventory" (which allows the player to hold one item and access it without having to enter the inventory screen), an [[autosave]] feature, and a "Compass Look" feature (which utilises the [[Gyroscope|gyroscopic]]-based iDevice [[accelerometer]] controls to mimic looking around in the 360 degree environment).<ref name="iOS"/>
==Plot== {{See also|Dracula#Plot summary|Dracula: Resurrection#Plot}}
The game opens with the final scene from ''Dracula: Resurrection''; [[Jonathan Harker]] (voiced by [[David Gasman]]) rescuing his wife [[Mina Harker|Mina]] ([[Gay Marshall]]) from [[Count Dracula|Dracula's]] castle and vowing to defeat the Count upon returning to London. Harker has come to realise Dracula called Mina to [[Transylvania]] precisely so Harker would follow her. Upon arriving in the [[Tihuța Pass|Borgo Pass]], Dracula knew Harker would uncover the Dragon Ring, which Dracula himself could not do as it had been placed under the protection of [[Saint George]]. Harker then brought the ring to the castle just as Dracula had planned. Once Harker arrived in the castle, Dracula had instructed his [[Brides of Dracula|brides]] to kill him and take the ring, but Harker had been able to rescue Mina and escape, with the ring still in his possession.<ref>{{cite book | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary PC Instruction Manual | url=http://www.replacementdocs.com/download.php?view.5036 | chapter=Introduction | publisher=[[DreamCatcher Interactive]] | year=2000 | page=3 | accessdate=February 23, 2016 | quote=London, 20 October 1904. [[Mina Harker|Mina]] has just dozed off at last! Our long return voyage to England gives me the opportunity to come to terms with this whole sorry adventure. [[Count Dracula|Dracula]]'s plan was truly diabolical. He first ensured that Mina followed him to [[Transylvania]], knowing full well that I would set off immediately to find her. If his plan had worked, Dracula would have won on all counts: he would have regained possession of Mina and before long, she would have become his queen; he tortured me psychologically by delaying my arrival at the castle; me, who had dared to stand in his way seven long years before. But far worse than that, once I was within his lair, he had his [[Brides of Dracula|female vampires]] try to eliminate me in order to recapture the symbol of hid devilish power: the Dragon's Ring. This ring had been placed under the protection of [[Saint George]], and Dracula used me to remove it from its holy hiding place because he knew he was not able to do it himself. He went to great lengths to ensure that I came across it on my way, so that I would take it and being it with me to the castle. It had all been planned right from the start, except, of course, our escape.}}</ref>
As the game begins, Harker has left the Dragon Ring with [[John Seward|Dr. Seward]] ([[Paul Barrett (actor)|Paul Barrett]]), and has gone to Dracula's former London home, Carfax Abbey, to search for clues. Inside, he is attacked by several [[bat]]-like humanoids. He manages to destroy them, and heads to Seward's [[Psychiatric hospital|insane asylum]]. Seward tells Harker that Dracula has purchased a [[Movie theater|cinema]] in London called The Styx. He also informs him that his research has led him to conclude part of the Dragon Ring is missing - a [[diamond]] at its centre which is said to counteract the [[evil]] of the outer ring. In an effort to determine how to proceed against Dracula, Seward puts Mina under [[hypnosis]] and she describes the nearby Highgate Cemetery. Harker heads to the cemetery, where he see Dracula entering a secret tomb. He attempts to follow, but a light is omitted from some nearby stone [[gargoyle]]s, and he is knocked out.
He wakes up the next day and heads back to the asylum to find Mina and Seward have been taken by Dracula. In Seward's safe, he finds the Dragon Ring and correspondence between Seward and a colleague, who had found a 15th-century book which details the rivalry between [[Vlad the Impaler|Vlad Tepes]] and his younger brother [[Radu cel Frumos|Radu]]. When their father, [[Vlad II Dracul|Dracul]], died, he left the Dragon Ring to Radu on the advice of his [[Ceremonial magic|magician]], Dorko. Tepes was furious and locked Radu in his castle, banished Dorko to the [[dungeon]]s, and split the ring in two, hiding the diamond and keeping the outer ring for himself. Tepes then had a [[Heresy|heretical]] monk, Thadeus, build a "Last Sanctuary" deep within the castle, to which he could retreat in times of crisis. For safe keeping, Harker gives the Dragon Ring to Hopkins ([[Steve Gadler]]), a patient in the asylum who was under the influence of Dracula, but who has fallen in love with Mina, and is willing to help Harker save her.
Harker heads to The Styx, but is gassed. He awakens in Dracula's bedroom in Transylvania. Dracula ([[Allan Wenger]]) tells him he will spare his life if Harker reveals where the Dragon Ring is, but Harker refuses. Dracula leaves, promising Harker a slow death. Shortly thereafter, Hopkins arrives and releases Harker. When he leaves the room, he realises he is still in The Styx; the room was a set made to look like Dracula's room. As he explores, he encounters Seward, who is turning into a [[vampire]]. Seward tells Harker he must destroy Carfax, whilst he himself will destroy The Styx, leaving Dracula nowhere to hide in London. Harker leaves, and Seward blows up The Styx, killing himself before he turns into a vampire.
Harker sets fire to Carfax and heads to Highgate, where he finds a note from Hopkins telling him how to access Dracula's tomb. With the note is the Dragon Ring. Harker enters the tomb and encounters Dracula, who tells him he is returning to Transylvania with Mina. Harker gives chase, using the [[Shaft mining|mines]] to enter the castle. Underneath the castle, he finds an ancient [[prison]] in which he finds Radu's diamond. In the dungeons, he once again encounters Dorko ([[Gay Marshall]]), who tells him her previous betrayal of him failed to earn her Dracula's trust. He shows her the diamond, and she tells him she can reassemble the Dragon Ring, but before she does so she is stabbed by one of Dracula's brides. As she dies, she tells Harker he must restore the ring and defeat Dracula. Harker works his way through the traps in the castle, eventually taking a [[Aerial lift|cable car]] to Dracula's [[keep]].
Upon arriving, a gypsy attacks Harker, but Hopkins appears and sacrifices himself to save him. As he dies, Hopkins gives Harker the key to the Last Sanctuary. Harker explores further, killing Dracula's remaining gypsies, and eventually entering the sanctuary itself, but he is taken prisoner by Dracula's brides. They bring him to Dracula, who tells him Mina is now his forever. Harker appeals to Mina, reminding her they are married in the eyes of [[God]], but she says she cannot remember. He shows her their wedding ring, and she regains her memories. A furious Dracula says both she and Harker must die, but Harker combines Radu's diamond with the Dragon Ring, and Dracula is engulfed in light as the castle begins to crumble. Dracula's brides are crushed by falling debris, and Dracula himself is killed when he is impaled by a statue of Saint George. As the castle ceases collapsing, Harker embraces Mina.
==Development== {{expand-section|date=July 2018}}
==Reception== {{Video game reviews | MC = 68/100<ref name="MCPC">{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/dracula-the-last-sanctuary | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary for PC | publisher=[[Metacritic]] | accessdate=September 20, 2013}}</ref> | AdvGamers = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name="AdvGamers">{{cite web | url=http://www.adventuregamers.com/articles/view/17505 | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary (PC) Review | publisher=[[Adventure Gamers]] | date=May 20, 2002 | last=Gmiterko | first=Christina | accessdate=September 22, 2013}}</ref> | GSpot = 5.5/10<ref name="GSpot">{{cite web | url=http://www.gamespot.com/reviews/dracula-the-last-sanctuary-review/1900-2693391/ | title=Dracula: The Last Sanctuary (PC) Review | publisher=[[GameSpot]] | date=March 7, 2001 | last=Dulin | first=Ron | accessdate=September 22, 2013}}</ref> | IGN = 7.8/10<ref name="IGN"/> | PCGUS = 50%<ref>{{cite journal | title=Dracula: Resurrection Review | journal=[[PC Gamer]] | date=April 2001 | page=81}}</ref> | rev1 = [[Adventure Classic Gaming]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref name="ACG"/> | rev2 = ''[[Computer Games Magazine]]'' | rev2Score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref name=cgm>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040808085630/http://www.cgonline.com:80/reviews/draculalas-02-r1.html| url=http://www.cgonline.com:80/reviews/draculalas-02-r1.html | title=''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'' | date=April 27, 2001 | author=Wand, Kelly | archivedate=August 8, 2004 | work=[[Computer Games Magazine]] | deadurl=yes }}</ref> | rev3 = ''[[EP Daily|The Electric Playground]]'' | rev3Score = 8/10<ref name=elecplay>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20030330132643fw_/http://www.elecplay.com:80/review.html?article=5303#mr_toppy | url=http://www.elecplay.com:80/review.html?article=5303#mr_toppy | title=''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'' | author=Silvester, Niko | date=March 7, 2001 | archivedate=March 30, 2003 | work=[[EP Daily|The Electric Playground]] | deadurl=yes }}</ref> }}
The PC version of the game received "mixed or average reviews," and holds an aggregate score of 68 out of 100 on [[Metacritic]], based on fourteen reviews.<ref name="MCPC"/> In North America, its computer version sold 67,776 retail units during 2001,<ref name=randysales3>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20020619111456/http://www.justadventure.com:80/articles/State_of_Adventure_Gaming/Mar-02/sales2001.shtm | url=http://www.justadventure.com:80/articles/State_of_Adventure_Gaming/Mar-02/sales2001.shtm | title=State of Adventure Gaming - March 2002 - 2001 Sales Table | date=March 2002 | author=Sluganski, Randy | archivedate=June 19, 2002 | work=[[Just Adventure]] | deadurl=yes }}</ref> and 21,204 in the first six months of 2002.<ref name=randysales4>{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050314010007/http://justadventure.com:80/articles/State_of_Adventure_Gaming/August2002/SalesJune2002.shtm | url=http://justadventure.com:80/articles/State_of_Adventure_Gaming/August2002/SalesJune2002.shtm | title=State of Adventure Gaming - August 2002 - June 2002 Sales Table | date=August 2002 | author=Sluganski, Randy | archivedate=March 14, 2005 | work=[[Just Adventure]] | deadurl=yes }}</ref> According to [[Microïds]], the combined global sales of ''Dracula 2'' and its predecessor, ''Dracula: Resurrection'', surpassed 1 million copies by June 2007.<ref name=draculasales>{{cite press release | url=https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/mc2-launches-dracula-3 | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180710224114/https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/mc2-launches-dracula-3 | archivedate=July 10, 2018 | title=MC2 Launches ''Dracula 3''! | publisher=[[GamesIndustry.biz]] | location=[[Paris]] | date=June 26, 2007 | deadurl=no }}</ref>
[[Adventure Classic Gaming]]'s Zack Howe scored the game 4 out of 5, praising the [[Video game graphics|graphics]]; "As with its predecessor, [[Pre-rendering|pre-rendered]] graphics are solely used for [[cutscene]]s and are truly a sight to behold. [...] All of the [[3D modeling|3D characters]] are amazingly detailed. Their faces are expressive and their eyes subtly capture the different personalities." Although he was critical of the "[[pixel]]-hunting" nature of some of the [[Puzzle video game|puzzles]], he concluded "''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'' is definitely a much better game than ''Dracula: Resurrection.'' I recommend this game to any adventure fan without reservation. The excellent production values and thoughtful gameplay makes this game a worthy sequel for the series."<ref name="ACG"/>
[[IGN]]'s Steve Butts scored it 7.8 out of 10. He too praised the graphics, saying "Just using flat backgrounds, the game [[Rendering (computer graphics)|renders]] the illusion of a full [[3D computer graphics|3D environment]] better than any game I've seen yet. Even better, the game looked (and ran) just as well on a simple 333[[Hertz|MHz]] with a [[Voodoo2]] as it did on a 600MHz with a [[Voodoo 5]]." He too was somewhat critical of some of the puzzles, but concluded "Although some of the situations are kind of a stretch, the story is well done and interesting in its own right. Hell, even the parts that threaten your suspension of disbelief are kind of cool."<ref name="IGN"/>
[[Adventure Gamers]]' Christina Gmiterko scored it 3 out of 5, praising the graphics and calling them "its strongest selling point." However, she was critical of the core gameplay; "I spent a lot of the game waving my cursor across the screen to find a hot spot where an inventory item needed to be used. Once I found it I would just try combining every inventory item I had with the obstacle at hand until I found the one that worked because more often than not it wasn't reasonably obvious what item you should be using or why you should be using it. By the time I reached the end I felt like I had seen the inventory screen almost as much as I had the actual game."<ref name="AdvGamers"/>
[[GameSpot]]'s Ron Dulin scored it 5.5 out of 10. He criticised the game for having "huge lapses in logic, no atmosphere, and very little in the way of respect for [[Bram Stoker]]'s original story." He was critical of the lack of [[Horror fiction|horror]] in the game; "''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'' doesn't even manage to maintain a slightly creepy atmosphere. The opening would lead you to believe otherwise, because of its creepy music that sets the stage for a terrifying adventure. Unfortunately, this music is all but absent from the game afterward. The [[voice acting]] doesn't help: The confused-sounding actors ham it up like they're auditioning for a part in [[Mark Borchardt]]'s ''[[Coven (film)|Coven]]''." He concluded "The puzzles will be enough for those who are content with being limited to the challenge of finding a way past locked doors and blocked passageways. But great games transcend their genre's limitations, while good games work within them. Mediocre games, like ''Dracula: The Last Sanctuary'', only serve to remind us of why such things are limitations in the first place."<ref name="GSpot"/>

Reyes]] | creative_director = [[Roy Iglesias]] | starring = {{Plainlist| * [[Glaiza de Castro]] * [[Kylie Padilla]] * [[Gabbi Garcia]] * [[Sanya Lopez]]}} | opentheme = "Tadhana!" by [[Bayang Barrios]] | country = [[Philippines]] | language = {{Plainlist| * [[Tagalog language|Tagalog]] * [[Enchanta]]}} | num_episodes = 218 | list_episodes = List of Encantadia episodes | executive_producer = Winnie Hollis-Reyes | location = {{plainlist| * [[Fortune Island (Philippines)|Fortune Island]], Philippines * [[Manila, Philippines]]}} | camera = [[Multiple-camera setup]] | runtime = 25-36 minutes | company = GMA Entertainment TV | network = [[GMA Network]] | picture_format = [[1080i]] ([[HDTV]]) | first_aired = {{start date|2016|7|18}} | last_aired = {{end date|2017|5|19}} | related = {{Plainlist| * ''[[Encantadia]]'' {{small|(2005)}} * ''[[Etheria]]'' * ''[[Encantadia: Pag-ibig Hanggang Wakas]]''}} | website = http://www.encantadia.com.ph }}
'''''Encantadia''''' is a [[Philippine television drama]] [[fantasy]] series broadcast by [[GMA Network]]. The series is based from the [[Encantadia (2005 TV series)|2005 television series of the same name]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tribune.net.ph/life-style/what-s-on-tv-for-2016 |title=What's on TV for 2016 |author=Llemit, Kathleen |date=January 8, 2016 |website=trbune.net.ph |publisher=The Daily Tribune |accessdate=March 31, 2016}}</ref> it served as a [[Reboot (fiction)|reboot]] and the fourth television series in the [[Encantadia]] franchise. Directed by [[Mark A. Reyes]], it stars [[Kylie Padilla]], [[Gabbi Garcia]], [[Sanya Lopez]] and [[Glaiza de Castro]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://cebudailynews.inquirer.net/90606/gma-network-reveals-cast-of-encantadia-requel |title=GMA Network reveals cast of ‘Encantadia’ requel |author=Mariñas, Niza |date=April 4, 2016 |website=cebudailynews.inquirer.net |publisher=Cebu Daily News |access-date=April 5, 2016 |quote=}}</ref> It premiered on July 18, 2016 replacing ''[[Poor Señorita]]'' on the network's Telebabad line up and worldwide on [[GMA Pinoy TV]]. The series concluded on May 19, 2017 with a total of 218 episodes.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=The Philippine Star |url=http://www.philstar.com/entertainment/2015/11/06/1519047/encantadia-return-2016 |title=‘Encantadia’ to return in 2016 |date=November 6, 2015 |website=philstar.com |accessdate=March 29, 2016}}</ref> It was replaced by ''[[Mulawin vs. Ravena]]'' in its timeslot.
The series is streaming online on [[iflix]] and [[YouTube]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Dacanay, Aimee |title=#TeamReplay? Here's how you can watch Encantadia 2016 online |url=http://www.spot.ph/entertainment/movies-music-tv/67111/encantadia-mr-robot-iflix-a00001-20160719 |publisher=Spot |accessdate=October 3, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Encantadia now exclusively on iflix |url=http://manilastandardtoday.com/showbitz/213095/encantadia-now-exclusively-on-iflix.html |publisher=Manila Standard Today |accessdate=October 3, 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161005084023/http://manilastandardtoday.com/showbitz/213095/encantadia-now-exclusively-on-iflix.html |archivedate=October 5, 2016}}</ref> In November 2017, the director's cut of the final episode was published on YouTube.<ref>{{cite web|URL=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLGRhcC_vtOrb9DLVQyal6UEBd1UnzrAWc |title=Encantadia 2016 (Full Episodes) - YouTube |accessdate=February 16, 2018}}</ref>
==Premise== Four Sang’gres, Pirena, Amihan, Alena and Danaya — guard the gems that hold the power to maintain peace and harmony in the world of Encantadia. The sisters' bond is broken when Pirena discovers that their mother, is afraid of her desire to become the queen of Encantadia.<ref>{{cite web|URL=http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/about/ |title=Encantadia |accessdate=April 2, 2018}}</ref>

==Production== {{Main|Encantadia}} On November 5, 2015, [[Felipe Gozon]], the chairman and CEO of [[GMA Network|GMA Network Inc.]] announced during a GMA Network press conference that the remake of the [[Encantadia|2005 fantasy series]] is part of the network's program line-up for 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/entertainment/gma/articles/2015-11-06/19681/Encantadia-set-to-open-again-its-kingdom-in-2016 |title='Encantadia' set to open again its kingdom in 2016? |author=Acar, Aedrianne |date=November 6, 2015 |website=GMANetwork.com |publisher=[[GMA Network]] |access-date=March 29, 2016 |quote=}}</ref> On January 6, 2016, director [[Mark A. Reyes]] said that he would return as the director of the series.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.GMANetwork.com/entertainment/gma/articles/2016-01-07/20789/Direk-Mark-Reyes-naghahanda-na-para-sa-Encantadia |title=Direk Mark Reyes, naghahanda na para sa 'Encantadia' |last1=Noguera |first1=Al Kendrick |date=January 7, 2016 |website=GMANetwork.com |publisher=[[GMA Network]] |access-date=March 29, 2016 |quote=}}</ref> [[Suzette Doctolero]], who created ''Encantadia'' remained as concept creator and head writer for the series.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Noguera|first1=AL|title=Concept creator Suzette Doctolero, ipinakilala ang bagong characters sa 'Encantadia' 2016|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/stories/inside/gma/articles/2016-07-14/24319/WATCH-Direk-Mark-Reyes-naging-emosyonal-sa-grand-press-conference-ng-Encantadia-kagabi|website=GMA Network|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref> Encantadia was Doctolero's first head writing project with the network in 2005, and also served as her training for writing a fantasy story for the first time.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Noguerra|first1=Al|title=Suzette Doctolero reveals 'Encantadia' was her first telefantasya project|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/stories/inside/gma/articles/2016-07-18/24396/Suzette-Doctolero-reveals-Encantadia-was-her-first-telefantasya-project|website=GMA Network|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref>
The series was first publicized during [[Marian Rivera]]'s renewal of contract at GMA Network on February 16, 2016 where she was announced for the role of [[Mine-a]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Torres|first1=Rap|title=Marian Rivera to play ‘Ynang Reyna’ in ‘Encantadia’ 2016 remake|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/marian-rivera-to-play-ynang-reyna-in-encantadia-2016-remake/|accessdate=October 2, 2016|agency=Manila Bulletin|publisher=Manila Bulletin|date=February 16, 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160518174240/http://www.mb.com.ph/marian-rivera-to-play-ynang-reyna-in-encantadia-2016-remake/|archivedate=May 18, 2016|df=}}</ref> The following day, it was announced by director Mark Reyes in that the series was on pre-production.<ref>{{cite web|title=Encantadia, nasa pre-production na|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/video/359952/24oras/encantadia--remake-nasa-pre-production-stage-na|website=GMA News Online|publisher=GMA Network|accessdate=October 2, 2016}}</ref> The first teaser of Encantadia premiered on February 14, 2016 featuring a snippet of the gems and the theme song.<ref>{{cite web|title=Ang Brilyante ng Apoy teaser|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/videos/inside/gma/videos/2016-02-15/44484/Encantadia-Ang-Brilyante-ng-Apoy|website=GMA Network|publisher=GMA Network|accessdate=October 2, 2016}}</ref> The first trailer was released June 11, 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/569627/showbiz/chikaminute/watch-official-trailer-ng-encantadia-2016 |title=WATCH: Official trailer ng 'Encantadia' 2016|date=November 6, 2015 |website=GMANetwork.com |publisher=[[GMA Network]] |access-date=June 11, 2016 |quote=}}</ref>
On September 15, 2016, the director stated that the retelling concluded after 43 episodes, and the 45th will be the start of the 2005's sequel, stating that "The retelling ends. And the sequel begins".<ref>{{cite web|last1=Ilaya|first1=Felix|title=LOOK: Direk Mark Reyes on the future of Encantadia|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/stories/inside/gma/articles/2016-09-13/25567/Gurna-at-Ades-magtatapat-sa-Encantadia|website=GMA Network|publisher=GMA Network|accessdate=September 16, 2016}}</ref> He further added that it was not about 2005 version anymore, and new storyline will emerge on the series.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Anarcon|first1=James Patrick|title=Encantadia director hints a new chapter|url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/24569/%7B%7Burl%7D%7D|website=Philippine Entertainment Portal|publisher=PEP.ph|accessdate=September 16, 2016}}</ref>
===Casting=== [[Marian Rivera]] plays the role of (Inang Reyna) ''Mine-a'', the Queen of Lireo, (originally played by [[Dawn Zulueta]]).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/555451/showbiz/chikaminute/marian-rivera-to-star-as-ynang-reyna-in-encantadia-2016 |title=Marian Rivera to star as Ynang Reyna in Encantadia 2016 |last1=Dabu |first1=Bianca Rose |last2= |first2= |date=February 16, 2016 |website=GMANetwork.com |publisher=GMA News Online |access-date=March 29, 2016 |quote=}}</ref> Rivera's husband, [[Dingdong Dantes]], who played Ybarro in the [[Encantadia|original series]] plays the role of ''Raquim'', prince of Sapiro (originally played by [[Richard Gomez]]). It serves as the comeback series of the couple after welcoming their first daughter and their last show together was My Beloved in 2012. Klea Pineda and Migo Adecer also join the cast as part of their prize after winning ''[[StarStruck (season 6)|StarStruck VI]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/23109/marian-rivera-confirmed-to-be-part-of-emencantadiaem-who-will-be-her-co-stars |title=Marian Rivera confirmed to be part of Encantadia; who will be her co-stars? |last1=Dimaculangan |first1=Jocelyn |last2= |first2= |date=February 16, 2016 |website=PEP.ph |publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal |access-date=March 29, 2016 |quote=}}</ref>
On April 4, 2016, the four new ''Sang'gres'' of ''[[Encantadia]]'' were revealed live on ''[[24 Oras]]''. Amihan, the keeper of the wind gem, originally played by [[Iza Calzado]], is now portrayed by [[Kylie Padilla]]. In the show's press conference, Padilla stated that being cast in Encantadia puts you as an "A-lister" in show business.<ref name="Pstar">{{cite news|last1=Dizon|first1=Irish Christiane|title=Avisala, bitches|url=http://www.philstar.com/supreme/2016/04/23/1575683/avisala-bitches|accessdate=September 29, 2016|work=Philippine Star|agency=Philippine Star|publisher=Philippine Star|date=April 23, 2016}}</ref> [[Gabbi Garcia]] takes on the role of Alena, the keeper of the water gem, who was originally played by [[Karylle]]. Garcia stated that the series is her biggest break in the industry.<ref name="Pstar" /> She further stated, "...i’m not really gonna try to outdo but then, we’re not replacing them[...] just making a new, fresh version for the young audiences, for the generation now".<ref name="Pstar" /> Newcomer [[Sanya Lopez]] is Danaya, the youngest of the sisters and the keeper of the earth gem, played by [[Diana Zubiri]] in the original series. Lopez stated that having been compared to the original series was a big challenge for her, but in a positive way.<ref name="Pstar" /> [[Glaiza de Castro]] is the keeper of the gem of fire, Pirena, originally played by [[Sunshine Dizon]]. According to Doctolero, de Castro is the one and only choice for the role but she also auditioned for it. According to her, she watched and studied trainings from famous martial arts artists to get ready for the role.<ref name="Pstar" /> Other cast members including their roles also appeared after the announcement .<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/news/127958-encantadia-sanggres-gma-teleserye-2016 |title=Meet the 4 new sang'gres of the 'Encantadia' 2016 reboot |last1= |first1= |last2= |first2= |date=April 4, 2016 |website=rappler.com |publisher=Rappler |access-date=April 4, 2016 |quote=}}</ref>
[[Sunshine Dizon]], who played Pirena in the [[Encantadia|original series]], revealed on May 6, 2016 that she takes part on the retelling-sequel of the 2016 series with a big but different character role, as Adhara.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/565325/showbiz/chikaminute/original-sang-gre-sunshine-dizon-returns-to-encantadia |title=Original Sang'gre Sunshine Dizon returns to 'Encantadia' |last1=Tantiangco |first1=Aya |last2= |first2= |date=May 6, 2016 |website=GMANetwork.com |publisher=GMA News Online |access-date=May 7, 2016}}</ref> Meanwhile, [[Diana Zubiri]] who previously played Danaya is also cast as LilaSari.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Calderon|first1=Nora|title=Diana Zubiri, nag-trending nang ipakilala sa ‘Encantadia’|url=http://balita.net.ph/2016/10/21/diana-zubiri-nag-trending-nang-ipakilala-sa-encantadia/|website=Balita|publisher=Balita|accessdate=November 3, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Diana Zubiri, ibinahagi ang paghahandang ginawa sa kaniyang pagbabalik sa 'Encantadia'|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/585535/showbiz/chikaminute/diana-zubiri-ibinahagi-ang-paghahandang-ginawa-sa-kaniyang-pagbabalik-sa-encantadia|website=GMA Network|accessdate=November 3, 2016}}</ref>
A week before the show, Australian actor [[Conan Stevens]], best known for his role on the American fantasy television series ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', confirmed that he would join the cast in an unspecified role, which later on revealed as Vish'ka.<ref>{{cite news|title='Game of Thrones' actor joins 'Encantadia' 2016|url=http://www.rappler.com/entertainment/news/139273-game-of-thrones-actor-conan-stevens-joins-encantadia-2016|accessdate=July 12, 2016|work=[[Rappler]]|date=July 10, 2016}}</ref>
As the series progress, few special roles emerged; the first is [[Miguel Tanfelix]] who plays Pagaspas, a [[Mulawin]] with a mission to help the ''diwatas'' of Lireo.<ref>[http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/stories/inside/gma/articles/2016-08-15/24971/Miguel-Tanfelix-gaganap-muli-bilang-Pagaspas-ng-Mulawin-matapos-ang-12-years Miguel Tanfelix, gaganap muli bilang Pagaspas ng 'Mulawin' matapos ang 12 years] GMA Network. Retrieved July 9, 2016</ref> He played the same role 12 years ago on the series of the same name.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Anarcon|first1=James Patrick|title=Miguel Tanfelix reprises role as Mulawin Pagaspas in Encantadia 2016|url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/24335/miguel-tanfelix-reprises-role-as-mulawin-pagaspas-in-emencantadiaem-2016|website=Philippine Entertainment Portal|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref> The next would be [[Alden Richards]], who will also play a Mulawin whose appearance has not yet been televised.<ref>{{cite web|title=Alden Richards, sasamahan si Miguel Tanfelix sa 'Encantadia' bilang 'Mulawin'|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/578028/showbiz/chikaminute/alden-richards-sasamahan-si-miguel-tanfelix-sa-encantadia-bilang-mulawin|website=GMA News Online|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref> In an interview with Manila Times, Richards said, "...11 years ago. I remember I watched the show with my family and I was so mesmerized with all the special effects. [...]When I learned that GMA was doing a ‘requel’ of Encantadia, I was really wishing to be a part of the show. That’s why when they told me that I have a role in the series, I was so happy...".<ref>[http://www.manilatimes.net/alden-joins-encantadia-admits-missing-maine/281996/ Alden joins ‘Encantadia’ admits missing Maine] Lhar Santiago, Manila Times. Retrieved July 9, 2016</ref>
===Costume design=== {{quote box | quote = "The process is the same as when we make our signature gowns for clients here and abroad. Since the designs I've made still include my signature details, it was not that hard for me and my team to create the costumes. The only difference is that we had to consider how these gowns would appear against chroma optical filters used in television as Encantadia is a telefantasia which requires chroma." | source = — Libiran, on how Encantadia costumes were made.<ref name="Libiran" /> | align = right | width = 25% }} Encantadia's costume designer is Francis Libiran, a world-renowned and critically acclaimed designer in the Philippines who did an extensive research to come up with the designs.<ref name="Libiran">{{cite web|last1=Jocom|first1=Bea|title=Francis Libiran Talks About the New and Improved Encantadia Costumes|url=http://www.preview.ph/fashion/francis-libiran-talks-about-the-new-and-improved-encantadia-costumes-a00007-20160607|website=Preview|publisher=Preview|accessdate=October 8, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Gowns ng mga Sang'gre ng 'Encantadia,' sinaliksik ni Francis Libiran|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/566662/showbiz/chikaminute/gowns-ng-mga-sang-gre-ng-encantadia-sinaliksik-ni-francis-libiran|website=GMA Network|publisher=GMA Network|accessdate=October 8, 2016}}</ref> According to Libiran, his team brainstormed together with Encantadia's production team and watched old clips of Encantadia in [[YouTube]] to conceptualized the character's fashion sense.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Abando|first1=Paulo|title=Sang’gres in Libiran gowns|url=http://www.mb.com.ph/sanggres-in-libiran-gowns/|accessdate=October 8, 2016|agency=Manila Bulletin|publisher=Manila Bulletin|date=May 23, 2016}}</ref> The gowns of the sang'gres and Ynang Reyna is more edgy and fashionable compared to the ruggedness/cocky-themed costumes in 2005.<ref name="Libiran" /> Each gown depicts the powers and personalities of each sang'gre while showing one thing that they have in common- ''Royal''.<ref name="Libiran" /> The colors of their gowns match the colors of the gems that the Sang’gres are guarding. Just like in the original series, they wore elegant gowns when they were not in a battle.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Anarcon|first1=James Patrick|title=Francis Libiran designs costumes for Encantadia Sang'gres|url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/23497/francis-libiran-designs-costumes-for-emencantadiaem-sanggres|website=PEP|publisher=PEP.ph|accessdate=October 8, 2016}}</ref> He further stated, "A normal gown usually takes us two months to create but since we had to consider the time, we assigned a dedicated team of craftsmen to produce the outfits in just 15 days."<ref name="Libiran" /> According to the cast, they went on a strict diet and fitness trainings to secure their shape suited for their exquisite gowns.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Policarpio|first1=Allan|title=4 protectors of Encantadia’s gems revealed|url=http://entertainment.inquirer.net/196358/4-protectors-of-encantadias-gems-revealed|website=Inquirer|publisher=Philippine Daily Inquirer|accessdate=October 8, 2016}}</ref> The cast first appeared in costumes during "ToyCon 2016 Poplife Fan Xperience" at the [[SMX Convention Center]], [[Pasay City]] on June 10, 2016.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Noguerra|first1=Al Kendrick|title=LOOK: 'Encantadia' Sang'gres' first photo in their Francis Libiran costumes|url=http://www.gmanetwork.com/gma/encantadia/stories/inside/gma/articles/2016-06-02/23433/LOOK-Encantadia-Sanggres-first-photo-in-their-Francis-Libiran-costumes|website=GMA Network|publisher=GMA Network|accessdate=October 8, 2016}}</ref>
==Reception== ===Critical response=== According to a review by [[CNN Philippines]], ''Encantadia'' lived up to its long-gestating hype. The introduction and the narration was a big step-up for the show compared to the first one.<ref name="CNNReview">{{cite news|last1=Manlangit|first1=Shinji|title=Review: ‘Encantadia’ returns|url=http://cnnphilippines.com/life/entertainment/television/2016/07/19/encantadia-requel-review.html|accessdate=September 7, 2016|agency=CNN Philippines|issue=Entertainment|publisher=CNN Philippines|date=July 19, 2016}}</ref> It further stated that the new iteration looks better than the original and paces itself well in terms of narrative and plot.<ref name="CNNReview" /> CNN was also impressed with the fight scenes giving impressions that are being done on a grander scale.<ref name="CNNReview" /> They also stated that the scenes have depth and CG backgrounds are rendered beautifully and looks a lot slicker and a whole lot darker, looking like something from the PC version of [[The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim|Skyrim]] which they expressed as a huge improvement after over a decade.<ref name="CNNReview" /> Anthea Reyes of WheninManila.com was also impressed of the series stating: "...all of our childish fantasies have returned to primetime television and it’s come back bigger, better, and infinitely more awesome..."<ref name="wheninmanila">{{cite web|last1=Reyes|first1=Anthea|title=WhenInManila.com Reviews the New Encantadia: Behold the Upgrades|url=http://www.wheninmanila.com/wheninmanila-com-reviews-the-new-encantadia-behold-the-upgrades/|website=When In Manila|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref> She also stated that "the writing team is using this opportunity to the fullest to solidify the myth, the plot holes, and the motivations of everything. The writers of the show were able to place meaning in an aesthetic choice made from way before and further enrich the story."<ref name="wheninmanila" /> She also noted that the details of characters costume, to the clarified presence of the nomadic soldiers post Sappiro-Hathoria war, up until the background music used per every shot were all world class.<ref name="wheninmanila" /> [[FHM Philippines]] also made a review of the show and states that the creators of the show made an effort to make a living and breathing world and they succeeded.<ref name="FHMreview">{{cite web|last1=Dela Cruz|first1=Rey|title=5 Things We Like About The New Encantadia|url=http://www.fhm.com.ph/lifestyle/entertainment/encantadia-2016-review-a387-20160719-lfrm2|website=FHM Philippines|publisher=FHM Philippines|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref> They also imposed that even though it was heavily inspired by Hollywood fantasy movies, it has the FIlipino flavor adding its own twist.<ref name="FHMreview" /> They also pointed out that one of the shows strengths is that it has its own unique story. FHM further stated that: "...Like the original that came 11 years before it, Encantadia gives audiences something new to watch when it comes to primetime programming. Finally, something to cleanse our palate from all the drama and romantic programs that we've grown accustomed to."<ref name="FHMreview" />
A review by ''[[Philippine Entertainment Portal]]'' stated that the show’s director of photography and cameramen were impressive for utilizing different creative camera angles and techniques as it contributed to the intensity and excitement in the scene.<ref name="PEPreview1">{{cite web|last1=Anarcon|first1=James Patrick|title=Encantadia 2016 SNEAK PEEK: Five highlights to look forward to in pilot episode|url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/24058/five-highlights-to-look-forward-to-in-emencantadiaems-pilot-episode|website=PEP.ph|publisher=Philippine Entertainment Portal|accessdate=September 7, 2016}}</ref> They also gave positive feedback to its musical scoring stating that "...One of the factors that contributed to Encantadia 2005’s success is its musical scoring, in fact, it was even commended in the Asian Television Awards for Best Original Music Score. This requel did not disappoint when it comes to this aspect. The musical scorer seemed to compose different pieces suited to each kingdom since each had its own theme[...]the modernized, upbeat version of "Tadhana" also inensified the fight scenes."<ref name="PEPreview1" />
Because of the good ratings and the success of the show, ''Encantadia'' is slated or expected to have another season. This was hinted on few scenes in its finale showing Cassiopea's twin, who lives in the ice kingdom in the far northern part of Encantadia, seems to pose a threat to diwatas. This was attested further by an Instagram post of Director Mark Reyes that the finale episode is his "official statement".
===Ratings=== According to [[AGB Nielsen Philippines]]' Mega Manila household television ratings, the pilot episode of ''Encantadia'' earned a 26.1% rating.<ref>{{cite web|title=AGB: 10 Top-rating Pilot and Finale Primetime episodes in 2016 |author=Ching, Mark Angelo |date=January 1, 2017 |url=https://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/25257/agb-10-top-rating-pilot-and-finale-primetime-episodes-in-2016 |accessdate=January 24, 2018}}</ref> While the final episode scored a 13.8% rating in Nationwide Urban Television Audience Measurement people in television homes.<ref>{{Cite web|title=May 19 (Fri) TV Ratings / AGB Nielsen / NUTAM People in TV Homes (Evening). |url=http://www.pep.ph/news/pepalerts/read/20477}} Retrieved 2017-05-22.</ref>

{{Notability|Companies|date=February 2010}} {{Infobox company |name = F4, previously F4-Toys |type = [[Privately held company]] |foundation = [[Paris]], [[France]] (2002) |location_city = [[Paris]] |location_country = [[France]] |key_people = [[Bruno Heintz]], [[Entrepreneur|Co-founder]] and [[Chairman#Types|Executive Chairman]];
[[Alexis Galley]], [[Frédérick Raynal]] |industry = [[Video games]] |products = ''Lafuma Unlimit'', ''Empire of Sports'', ''Exalight''... |homepage = [http://www.f4-group.com www.f4-group.com] }} '''F4''', formerly known as '''F4-Toys''', is a French video game developer based in Paris. The company is located near the [[Champs Élysées]]. == List of games == *2002 Pocket Castle (prototype) *2003 Trium Planeta (prototype) *2004 Castle! Castle! (prototype) *2005 Stardust Academy (prototype) *2005 ''Lafuma Unlimit'' *2006 Eco - Battle with Detritus *2007 Lafuma Unlimit 2 *2008 ''Exalight'', a massively multiplayer online racing game. *2008-2016 ''[[Empire of Sports]]'': first massively multiplayer (MMO) sport game and virtual world {{DEFAULTSORT:F4 (Corporation)}} [[Category:Companies established in 2002]] [[Category:Video game companies of France]] [[Category:Companies based in Paris]] [[Category:Video game development companies]] [[Category:Privately held companies of France]] [[Category:2002 establishments in France]]

{{About|a former Canadian corporation|Other uses|Famous Players (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox company | name = Famous Players | logo = [[File:Famous Players logo.svg|Famous Players logo|250px]] | type = [[Private company|Private]] | traded_as = | former_name = | genre = | fate = Acquired *Most theatres sold to [[Cineplex Entertainment|Cineplex Galaxy LP]] *Cable operations sold to [[Rogers Cable]]systems | foundation = 1920 | defunct = 2005 | founder = Nathan Nathanson
{{small|(founder of earliest ancestor circuit)}} | predecessors = [[Famous Players Film Company]] | successors = * [[Cineplex Entertainment]] * [[Empire Theatres]] | location_city = [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]] | location_country = [[Canada]] | location = | locations = | area_served = [[Canada]] | key_people = John Bailey, President & CEO | industry = [[Film exhibitor]]
[[Bowling alley]]s
[[Cable Television]] | products = | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = Over 10,000 | parent = [[Viacom (original)|Viacom]] | divisions = Coliseum
SilverCity
Famous Players
Colossus
[[Scotiabank Theatre Toronto|Paramount Theatre]] | caption = ''Famous for Entertainment''
''Big Screen. Big Sound. Big Difference.'' | subsid = | homepage = | footnotes = | intl = }} '''Famous Players''' was a [[Canada|Canadian]]-based [[film exhibitor]] and [[cable television]] service provider. Famous Players operated numerous [[film|movie]] [[theatre]] locations in Canada from [[British Columbia]] to [[Newfoundland and Labrador]]. The company was owned by [[Viacom Canada]] but was sold to [[Onex Corporation]]-owned [[Cineplex Entertainment|Cineplex Galaxy LP]] in 2005. ==History== Famous Players Canadian Corporation dates back to the early days of [[Famous Players Film Company]] (later [[Paramount Pictures]]), founded in 1912, as its earliest predecessor, though that company did not have any operations in Canada until 1920, when it bought [[Nathan Nathanson]]'s Paramount Theatre chain, which Nathanson had established four years earlier.{{cite web|url=http://www.cineplex.com/News/Cineplex-Celebrates-100-Years-of-Movie-Memories.aspx|title=Cineplex Celebrates 100 Years of Movie Memories|author=Cineplex Entertainment|date=2012-01-18|accessdate=2013-06-27}}The Canadian "Paramount Theatre" chain was not affiliated with the American chain with the same name. Nathanson, along with being the 5th richest person in the world, became the first president of the resulting entity, '''Famous Players Canadian Corporation Limited'''.{{cite journal| url = http://www.filmstudies.ca/journal/pdf/cj-film-studies122_Moore_Nathanson_g.pdf| format = PDF| title = Nathan L. Nathanson Introduces Canadian Odeon: Producing national competition in film exhibition| last = Moore| first = Paul S.| journal = Canadian Journal of Film Studies| volume = 12| number = 2| date = Fall 2003| pages = 22–45| accessdate = 2010-11-11}} In 1923, Famous Players bought out rival [[Allen Theatres]], acquiring many buildings in the process .{{cite web|title=The Allen Family|url=http://www.cinemamuetquebec.ca/content/bio/34?lang=en|work=Silent Cinema in Quebec}} The Famous Players Theatres chain was always strongly linked with Paramount, and was a wholly owned subsidiary of Paramount Communications at the time that firm was acquired by [[Viacom (1971–2005)|Viacom]] in 1994. Some of the most high-profile and popular theatres in the Famous Players chain were the [[Ed Mirvish Theatre|Imperial]] and the [[Uptown Theatre (Toronto)|Uptown]] in [[Toronto]]; and the Capitol, [[Orpheum, Vancouver|Orpheum]], [[Stanley Industrial Alliance Stage|Stanley]], and Strand in [[Vancouver]]. Originally began with 13 theatres located in Ontario and British Columbia, the company quickly expanded its holdings to 100 by the end of 1926. Until the 1950s, the company continued to build its operations in the movie theatre sector. In 1952, however, Famous Players began to invest in the new technology. First, the company purchased the rights to a [[coinbox]] system that connected to television sets. A year later, it purchased its first broadcasting assets, [[CKCO-TV]] in [[Kitchener, Ontario]] and [[CFCM-TV]] in Québec City. At the end of the 1950s, the company acquired the first of many cable TV companies it would come to own, thus adding control over the distribution of its TV product. As the industry grew, starting in the mid-1960s, so did the assets of Famous Players in this segment. In 1971, the company sold off the majority of its shareholdings in its movie theatre and other non-TV-related entertainment holdings to [[Gulf and Western Industries|Gulf + Western Canada]] and subsequently changed its name to '''Canadian Cablesystems Limited''', reflecting the new focus of its operations. Canadian Cablesystems was the owner and operator of '''Metro Cable''', which served parts of [[Metro Toronto]], as well as a minority shareholder in several other cable companies, until it was purchased by [[Rogers Communications|Rogers Cablesystems Ltd.]] (founded by [[Edward Rogers III|Ted Rogers]]) in 1978."Rogers defends its bid to buy Canadian Cablesystems". ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'', September 13, 1978. Most famously, Famous Players Theatres allowed the lease on a property containing the entrance of one of its flagship [[Toronto]] locations, the Imperial Six, to lapse in 1986. Cineplex immediately took over the lease, denying Famous Players Theatres access to the portion of the property that they already owned outright. Famous Players eventually sold its property to Cineplex Odeon Cinemas, on the condition it never again be used to show filmed entertainment. Cineplex's live-theatre division renovated the theatre; renamed the [[Canon Theatre|Pantages Theatre]], it hosted ''[[The Phantom of the Opera (1986 musical)|The Phantom of the Opera]]'' for ten years. The theatre was renamed the Canon in 2001 and then again in 2011 as the [[Ed Mirvish Theatre]], which it is currently known, in honour of the popular businessman and ironically Mr. Drabinsky's main competitor in live theatre in Toronto.[https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/article/1097583--canon-theatre-renamed-in-honour-of-ed-mirvish Canon Theatre renamed in honour of Ed Mirvish | Toronto Star]. Thestar.com (2011-12-06). Retrieved on 2013-12-09. Famous Players expanded throughout the 1990s. Under chairman [[John Bailey (businessman)|John Bailey]], Famous Players re-built its infrastructure from 1997 to 2003 with new "megaplex" theatre brands featuring [[stadium seating]], such as SilverCity and Coliseum, with food courts and video games. Around that time, [[AMC Theatres]] entered the Canadian market, and most of the traditional ties between the existing chains and the major studios began to unwind, putting all three chains in full-on competition in several major markets. The company once operated a number of drive-in theatres, but most have been closed and replaced with modern theatres. Until 2004, it operated theatres in the [[Maritimes]], none of which were branded-concept theatres; these were sold to the region's dominant exhibitor, [[Empire Theatres]]. In June 2005, Viacom announced it would sell Famous Players to Cineplex Galaxy, controlled by [[Onex Corporation]] for [[Canadian dollar|$]]500 million (about [[United States dollar|US$]]397 million). This deal was completed on July 22, 2005. To satisfy antitrust concerns, on August 22, 2005 the group announced the sale of 27 locations in [[Ontario]] and [[western Canada]] to [[Empire Theatres]]. ==Assets== ===Theatres=== [[File:Famous Players Pickering.JPG|thumb|180px|Famous Players Pickering remains in operation as of 2015.]] {{See also|List of Cineplex Entertainment movie theatres}} Prior to merging with Cineplex, Famous Players operated five theatre brands: '''Famous Players''', '''SilverCity''', '''Coliseum''', '''Colossus''' and '''Paramount'''. Of these, Cineplex only preserved the first two brands. The Coliseum and Colossus theatres sold to Cineplex were renamed to Cineplex Cinemas, though the unique features of the original brands were preserved. Similarly, Paramount theatres now use the [[Scotiabank Theatre]] brand since 2007. ===Television stations=== *[[CKCO-TV]] - [[Kitchener, Ontario]] *[[CFCM-TV]] - [[Quebec City, Quebec]] ==See also== *[[List of Cineplex Entertainment movie theatres]] ==Notes== {{reflist|group=nb}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==Further reading== * [http://www.cbc.ca/cp/business/050613/b061356.html Cineplex Galaxy buying Famous Players movie chain from Viacom for $500 million] - [[CBC News]] ==External links== * [http://www.famousplayers.com/ Famous Players Theatres website] (redirects to the Cineplex website) * [http://cinematreasures.org/chain/49/show=all List of FP theatres (incomplete)] {{Cineplex}} {{Viacom}} {{Rogers Communications}} {{CATV Canada}} [[Category:Movie theatre chains in Canada]] [[Category:Movie theatre chains in the United States]] [[Category:Cable and DBS companies of Canada]] [[Category:Defunct companies of Canada]] [[Category:Companies based in Toronto]] [[Category:Entertainment companies of Canada]] [[Category:Entertainment companies established in 1920]] [[Category:Media companies established in 1920]] [[Category:Media companies disestablished in 2005]] [[Category:Communications in Ontario]] [[Category:Former Viacom subsidiaries]] [[Category:Cineplex Entertainment]] [[fr:Famous Players]]

page.title: Feltner v. Columbia Pictures Television, Inc.

revision.comment: /* External links */ added library of congress source for scan of U.S. Reports
revision.text:
{{Infobox SCOTUS case |Litigants=Feltner v. Columbia Pictures Television, Inc. |ArgueDate=January 21 |ArgueYear=1998 |DecideDate=March 31 |DecideYear=1998 |FullName=C. Elvin Feltner, Jr., Petitioner v. Columbia Pictures Television, Incorporated |USVol=523 |USPage=340 |ParallelCitations=118 S. Ct. 1279; 140 [[L. Ed. 2d]] 438; 1998 [[U.S. LEXIS]] 2301; 66 U.S.L.W. 4245; 46 [[U.S.P.Q.2d]] ([[Bloomberg BNA|BNA]]) 1161; Copy. L. Rep. ([[CCH (company)|CCH]]) ¶ 27,752; 163 [[A.L.R. Fed.]] 721; 26 Media L. Rep. 1513; 98 Cal. Daily Op. Service 2324; 98 Daily Journal DAR 3175; 1998 Colo. J. C.A.R. 1542; 11 Fla. L. Weekly Fed. S 417 |Prior=On writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit |Subsequent=Reversed and remanded |Holding=There is no statutory right to a jury trial under the Copyright Act, but the Seventh Amendment requires jury trials as the standard practice in copyright cases; therefore, an order denying a jury trial on damages violates the Seventh Amendment. |SCOTUS=1994-2005 |Majority=Thomas |JoinMajority=Rehnquist, Stevens, O'Connor, Kennedy, Souter, Ginsburg, Breyer |Concurrence=Scalia |LawsApplied=[[Seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|U.S. Const. amend. VII]], [[United States copyright law|Copyright Act § 504(c)]] }} '''''Feltner v. [[Columbia Pictures Television]], Inc.''''', 523 U.S. 340 (1998),<ref>{{ussc|name=Feltner v. Columbia Pictures Television, Inc.|volume=523|page=340|pin=|year=1998}}.</ref> was a case in which the [[Supreme Court of the United States]] ruled that if there is to be an award of statutory damages in a copyright infringement case, then the opposing party has the right to demand a jury trial.
==Background== C. Elvin Feltner, Jr., and the corporation he owns, Krypton International Corporation, operate 3 television stations which ran various television shows licensed from Columbia Pictures, including ''[[Who's the Boss?]]'', ''[[Silver Spoons]]'', ''[[Hart to Hart]]'', and ''[[T. J. Hooker]]''. After becoming delinquent in royalty payments, and being unable to resolve the impasse over the debt owed, Columbia revoked their license to run the shows. The stations kept running them anyway. Columbia sued Feltner, Krypton and some subsidiaries and executives of the corporation. The trial court found the infringement to be wilful, and denied Feltner's request for a jury trial on statutory damages. The court found every broadcast of every episode run on every television station to be a separate infringement, awarded the statutory maximum of $20,000 for each of the 440 acts, for a total of $8,800,000 in damages.
The [[United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit|Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit]] upheld the award.
==Opinion== The Supreme Court examined the statute in an attempt to resolve the issue without reaching constitutional issues. It found that there is no provision in the statute for a jury trial on the issue of statutory damages, therefore it must look at whether the law triggers the provisions of the requirement for [[Jury trial|trial by jury]] required by the [[Seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|Seventh Amendment]]. The question then being, were statutory damages in the form of a trial in a court of law, or a trial in a court of equity; if a court of law, then trial by jury may be demanded; if a court of equity, then trial by jury is not available unless provided for by statute. Upon examining long historical practice in copyright infringement cases, it decided that damages in a copyright case have historically been tried as a court of law, and not as a court of equity. Thus, the defendant Feltner was entitled to a jury trial on the issue of the amount of statutory damages.
The judgment was reversed and remanded back to the trial court.
After remand and the jury trial ordered by the Supreme Court, the jury awarded $72,000 in statutory damages for each of the 440 works infringed, for a total award of $31.68 million – over three and a half times the damages awarded by the Judge at the prior bench trial. On his appeal from the $31.68 million jury award to the Ninth Circuit, Feltner argued that the Supreme Court’s rulings (that the Copyright Act provided that statutory damages be awarded by Judges and the Seventh Amendment required that juries award those damaged) rendered statutory damages unconstitutional and void.<ref name=CPIIvKBBI>{{cite court |litigants=Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. vs. Krypton Broadcasting of Birmingham, Inc. |vol=152 |reporter=F.3d |opinion=1171 |pinpoint= |court=9th Cir. |date=1998 |url=https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/appellate-courts/F3/152/1171/543823/ |accessdate= |quote=}}</ref> The Ninth Circuit rejected this argument and affirmed the $31.68 million jury award.<ref name=CPIIvKBBI/> Feltner’s petition to the Supreme Court to hear the case for a second time was unsuccessful, leaving the $31.68 million award intact.
==See also== * [[List of United States Supreme Court cases, volume 523]] * [[List of United States Supreme Court cases]] * [[Lists of United States Supreme Court cases by volume]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * {{caselaw source | case = ''Feltner v. Columbia Pictures Television, Inc.'', {{ussc|523|340|1998|el=no}} | cornell =https://www.law.cornell.edu/supremecourt/text/96-1768 | courtlistener =https://www.courtlistener.com/opinion/118192/feltner-v-columbia-pictures-television-inc/ | findlaw = https://caselaw.findlaw.com/us-supreme-court/523/340.html | googlescholar = https://scholar.google.com/scholar_case?case=9799220060577752849 | justia =https://supreme.justia.com/cases/federal/us/523/340/case.html | loc =http://cdn.loc.gov/service/ll/usrep/usrep523/usrep523340/usrep523340.pdf | oyez =https://www.oyez.org/cases/1997/96-1768 }}

revision.text:
{{Infobox |title = Good Deeds Day |image = [[File:Good Deeds Day logo english.jpg|200px]] |label2 = Frequency | data2 = Annual |label3 = Next date | data3 = April 15, 2018 |label4 = Initiator | data4 = [[Shari Arison]] |label5 = Countries | data5 = 93 |label6 = Participants | data6 = 2,500,000 }}
'''Good Deeds Day''' is an international day of [[volunteering]]. Beginning in 2007, its mission is to unite people from around the world in doing good deeds for others and the planet.
==Background==
This day of [[community service]] was launched in 2007 in [[Israel]] by businesswoman and [[philanthropist]], [[Shari Arison]], through [[Ruach Tova]], a [[Nonprofit organization]] that connects between people who want to volunteer and organizations in need of assistance.
Speaking about the day, initiator Shari Arison said: {{Quote|text= I believe that if people will think good, speak good and do good, the circles of goodness will grow in the world. Good Deeds Day has become the leading day of giving and this year individuals, school children, students, soldiers and employees from many businesses are joining in for the annual Good Deeds Day with the aim of doing a good deed for others.<ref>[http://www.israel21c.org/900000-people-take-part-in-good-deeds-day/ 900,000 people take part in Good Deeds Day (Israel21c)]</ref>}}
==History==
Approximately 7,000 people participated in Israel in 2007. The day became global in 2011, with participants from around the world, including in the USA, [[Ukraine]] and [[Poland]]. In 2012, project organizers teamed up with [[MTV]] Global for a six-week-campaign on its online and TV platforms, exposing the message to 24 million viewers around the world. In 2014, [[NASDAQ]] invited Shari Arison to kick off Good Deeds Day in the trading day closing bell ceremony. 2017 marked the fourth year in a row of the NASDAQ and Good Deeds Day collaboration.
Good Deeds Day 2018 will be on Sunday, April 15, 2018.
In 2017, the 11th annual Good Deeds Day, approximately 2,500,000 participants from 93 countries volunteered, marking it the largest and most global day yet. To celebrate, project organizers held mega events in Kenya, Portugal, Italy, Poland and more.
Good Deeds Day and Ruach Tova are part of The [https://web.archive.org/web/20130927194639/http://www.arison.co.il/AFFHome.aspx?Lang=2 Ted Arison Family Foundation], the philanthropic arm of the Arison Group.
==Around the world==
In 2011, international companies [http://en.shikunbinui.co.il/ Shikun & Binui] and [[Bank Hapoalim]] were among the first international participants in Good Deeds Day outside of Israel. As of 2016, Good Deeds Day is celebrated in 75 countries worldwide, and has collaborated with major cities such as Rome, São Paulo, Kaohsiung City, and New York City to create special events. In the Good Deeds Day event at Herald Square, New York City, actor and activist [[Adrian Grenier]] supported the day by speaking at the event: {{Quote|It’s important to have a day in which we acknowledge wonderful people who are dedicated to doing good.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KtlwCohKXqY&&t=58s/ Adrian Grenier speaks in the 2016 Good Deeds Day Event at Herald Square, New York City (Youtube)]</ref>}}
[[Pope Francis]] endorsed the day in his Sunday sermon prior to Good Deeds Day 2015 in Rome and said: {{Quote|I send my wishes to the numerous groups of volunteers that have united to show solidarity by doing good deeds that promote a better society.<ref>[http://www.shariarison.com/en/content/pope-honors-good-deeds-day/ Pope honors Good Deeds Day (Shari Arison)]</ref>}}
In 2016 Good Deeds Day collaborated with [[Brazil]] based volunteering center Atados on a nationwide activation. Together they reached 10,000 volunteers around the country, and 40 cities across Brazil including major cities like [[Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brasília]], and [[São Paulo]].
In [[Latin America]], major Good Deeds Day events took place in Panama, Costa Rica, Brazil, Peru, and 16 other countries in the region.
In [[Taiwan]], Good Deeds Day collaborated with TAVE (Taiwan Association for Volunteer Effort) to create major citywide activities in [[Kaohsiung City]], Taiwan in 2016. Taiwan’s Vice President, [[Chen Chien-jen]], and Kaohsiung’s Mayor, [[Chen Chu]], were among the government officials honoring the day in 2016.<ref>[http://www.taiwanhot.net/?p=81289 (TaiwanHot, in Chinese)]</ref> [[Taoyuan City]] also hosted citywide activities, arranged by Taoyuan City Volunteer Service Association and other partnering organizations.<ref>[http://www.nownews.com/n/2016/05/05/2089169 (Now News, in Chinese)]</ref>
One of the biggest collaborations in [[Europe]] include SPES (Associazione Promozione e Solidarietà) in Italy, who organized a major Good Deeds Day event in Rome in 2016. Good Deeds Day invited runners in the [[Rome Marathon]] to join the “Roma Fun Run” and visit the Good Deeds Day fair of non-profits at the finish line.<ref>[http://www.insiemeperilbenecomune.org/ (Insieme per il bene comune, in Italian)]</ref>
===In Israel===
Good Deeds Day (Hebrew: יום מעשים טובים) first began in Israel in 2007 with 7,000 participants and grew to 1,500,000 in 2016. Local municipalities, companies, and nonprofit organizations all around the country participate by organizing special activities in their communities, renovating or painting buildings, building community gardens, and volunteering in many other ways for populations in need. Cities such as [[Tel Aviv]] and [[Jerusalem]] also host special Good Deeds Day events that are open to the public, such as the 2016 “Counselor’s Boulevard” that took place on [[Rothschild Boulevard]], Tel Aviv. Professionals gave free counseling sessions to passersby. Other public events include the 2015 Good Deeds Day nonprofit Fair at [[Rabin Square]], Tel Aviv, and [[Ashkelon]], which included hair donation stands, dog adoption area, and a give-and-take market.
==Dates==
{| {{Table}} ! Year !! Israeli date !! International date |- | 2007 | May 8 | N/A |- | 2008 | March 24 | N/A |- | 2009 | March 25 | N/A |- | 2010 | March 16 | N/A |- | 2011 | April 5 | April 5 |- | 2012 | March 20 | March 25 |- | 2013 | March 3 | March 10 |- | 2014 | March 11 | March 9 |- | 2015 | March 24 | March 15 |- | 2016 | March 15 | April 10 |- | 2017 | March 28 | April 2 |- | 2018 | March 13 | April 15 |- | 2019 | April 2 | April 7 |- | 2020 | March 24 | March 29 |} <nowiki>*</nowiki> Good Deeds Day became international in 2011.
==Awards== Good Deeds Day received the George W. Romney Affiliate Excellence Award in 2016.<ref>[http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/good-deeds-day-won-the-2016-george-w-romney-affiliate-excellence-award-300292332.html/ Good Deeds Day won the 2016 George W. Romney Affiliate Excellence Award (PR Newswire)]</ref>
==See also==
* [[Civic engagement]] * [[Community service]] * [[Global Youth Service Day]] * [[Join Hands Day]] * [[USA Weekend#Make A Difference Day|Make A Difference Day]] * [[Mandela Day]] * [[Martin Luther King Jr. Day#King Day of Service|MLK Day of service]] * [[Mitzvah Day International|Mitzvah Day]] * [[National Philanthropy Day]] (USA and Canada) * [[National Public Lands Day]] (US) * [[National Volunteer Week]] (US) * [[Random Acts of Kindness Day]] * [[September 11 National Day of Service]] (9/11 Day) * [[World Kindness Day]]

{{Infobox person | name = Henry J. Maar | image = Henry Maar.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1921<!-- {{Birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} or {{Birth-date and age|Month DD, YYYY}} --> | birth_place = | death_date = {{death year and age|1992|1921}} | death_place = | nationality = American | other_names = | occupation = | known_for = Balloon Twisting }} '''Henry J. Maar''' (1921–1992), known as "The Sultan of Balloons", was one of the pioneers in balloon twisting. He appeared for over a decade on episodes of the long running [[Bozo the Clown|Bozo's Circus]]. While the origins of balloon twisting is impossible to prove, [[Emmy Award]] winning producer/director Joseph Maar has provided evidence that his father, Henry, may be the founder of balloon twisting.<ref name="Joe">Maar, Joseph.[http://www.tmyers.com/marr.html The Story of Henry Maar] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930075403/http://www.tmyers.com/marr.html |date=2007-09-30 }} TMyers.com 6/20/06 Accessed 10/5/07</ref> [[Larry Moss (artist)|Larry Moss]] calls Joseph Maar's evidence "compelling" but warns that if Joseph Maar is correct then the history of balloon twisting would have to be rewritten.<ref>Moss, Larry. [http://www.balloonhq.com/column/bhq/jul06/ Evolution of Balloon Entertaining] BalloonHQ. July 2006. Accessed 10/5/07</ref> For example, the 1975 book by "Jolly the Clown" Petri credits "Herman Bonnert from Pennsylvania at a magician's convention in 1939" as being the first balloontwister.<ref>Dewey, Ralph. [http://www.balloonhq.com/column/dewey/aug06/ Balloon History] BalloonHQ Column. Accessed 10/5/07</ref>
==Joseph Maar's account==
Joseph Maar is the three time Emmy Award Winning Coordinating Director formerly with ESPN who worked on several shows including "Sports Center", "Sports Century", "Pardon the Interruption", "Around the Horn" and many other shows. He is also a client of some of the largest ballooning stores in the country.<ref name = "Joe" /> His story of his father has been picked up by several sources as the story of the origins of Balloon Twisting.<ref>[http://balloon_animal.totallyexplained.com/ History: The Inventor and History of Balloon Twisting] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130205001800/http://balloon_animal.totallyexplained.com/ |date=2013-02-05 }} Accessed 10/5/07</ref>
According to Joseph Maar, his father had pleurisy as a child and spent several years at a TB Sanitorium in Milwaukee. To develop his lungs, the facility had Henry blow up balloons. In the 1930s Henry became a [[vaudeville]] [[Magic (illusion)|magician]]. While preparing for a show in 1938 or 1939, Joseph writes, "he came back to the car to get the rest of his magic tricks only to find the vehicle had been broken into and everything was gone."<ref name = "Joe" /> With his magic tricks stolen, Maar went on stage and performed a show consisting primarily of balloon twisting. "Afterward, the agents went nuts and told him to forget the magic and to start doing the balloons. That <nowiki>[Henry Maar's agents said]</nowiki>'everyone's doing regular magic tricks but no one is doing the balloon tricks.'"<ref name = "Joe" />
Henry spent the next ten years performing under the stage name of "Johnny Ford" and entertaining GI's with the USO. After [[World War II]] an agent offered Maar twice his rate to wear a [[clown]] suit while performing his act. Joseph Maar states "that was the advent of a clown doing balloons."<ref name = "Joe" /> From the late 50s to mid-70s, Joseph and a 1968 article from the Waukegan Sun-Times{{Citation needed|date=November 2007}} cites that his father was a regular on "Bozo's Circus" and other children's shows. Two of these episodes reside with BalloonHQ and in IMDb he is listed in the credits of the March 16, 1977 episode of "Bozo's Circus."<ref>[http://imdb.com/title/tt0805092/ Bozo's Circus] and [http://imdb.com/title/tt0254011/ Bozo's Circus]</ref>
Joseph Maar also credits his father with inventing 'face painting.' According to Joseph, his father would sometimes have trouble with his makeup during long summertime events. To cover his own need to touch up his clown make up, he would invite kids up on stage where Henry Maar would "make them up" like a clown.<ref name="Joe" />
==Other origin stories==
While Joseph Maar's story has been accepted as "compelling," it is not viewed as conclusive. Other twisters have been credited with being the originator of balloon twisting. They include:
*Val Andrews, in ''Manual of Balloon Modeling, Vol. 1, An Encyclopedic Series'', credits H.J. Bonnert of Scranton, PA as being the "daddy of them all."<ref name = "history">Andrew, Val. ''Manual of Balloon Modeling, Vol. 1, An Encyclopedic Series'' 1981, Magico Magazine, NYC quoted on [http://www.balloonhq.com/faq/history.html Balloon History] BalloonHQ. Accessed 10/5/07</ref> *John Shirley, in the preface to ''One balloon animals; the rubber jungle / Roger's rubber jungle'' by Roger Siegel, writes "probably began sometime around 1920 but did not become popular until the advent of the skinny balloons after World War II...The inventor of the one balloon animal is unknown, but his origination opened the door to a new art." <ref name = "history" /> *Jim Church III writes, " Frank Zacone from Youngstown, Ohio was doing a balloon act during the 1940s and had been doing the act for some time."<ref name = "history"/>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
